cyclone.name: HERMINE
cyclone.current_location: about 305 mi W of Key West, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: expected to turn NNW then N-NE, cross Florida’s Gulf coast, and track northeastward just off the U.S. Southeast coast into the Atlantic
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida Big Bend / north-central Gulf coast

weather_observation.impacted_coast: Florida Gulf coast, then Georgia–Carolinas coastline and adjacent Atlantic waters
weather_observation.wind: Only a slight (≤3%) chance of tropical-storm-force gusts late Saturday; mainly breezy to windy coastal conditions.
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected at the port given distant track.
weather_observation.rainfall: No significant heavy rainfall expected; only occasional showers possible from outer moisture plume.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Elevated surf and rip currents along New Jersey and Long Island beaches over the weekend.
